msItem.note: The end of the text is missing.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation of Bibliothèque nationale de France in the upper right corner of the recto sides.
supportDesc.condition: Many folios are mutilated at the edges.

layout.ab: Ruling is partly visible; pricking is visible.
The upper line is written below the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.desc: In the manuscript is dated to 15th-16th Century on the basis of the "modern" form of the letter ሎ.

decoNote.desc: A drawing of a bearded male figure holding what is possibly a schematic representation of the Tablets of the Law. The caption written on the tablets reads: ፲፡ ቃላት፡ and the figure is labelled as ሙሴ፡ ሊቅ፡.
A drawing of two male figures holding a book. The caption reads: ለዛቲ፡ ሥዕል፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘለበጣ፡ ሰአሉ፡ ሎቱ፡ ኀበ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወኢየሉጣ፡. The right-hand figure is labelled አንክሮጦስ፡, on the book the title ቄርሎስ፡ is written.
More elaborate decorative bands are at the beginning of the introduction and the homilies on the birth of Christ, for the beginning of Lent, for the first and the third Sunday of Lent.

item.q: በእንተ፡ ብርዕ፡ ወቀለም፡ ወብራና። ፩ገብር፡ ጽሩዕ፡ ዘፈተና። ሰአሉ፡ ሎቱ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ጻና፡ ኀበ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ፍሡሕ፡ ለአንጌበናዊት፡ ሕፃና፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቀርና፡ ከመ፡ ያድኅና፡ ለነፍሱ፡ እሞተ፡ ሙስና። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

item.desc: Label with shelfmarks on the inner side of the front board.

history.origin: The name ጻና mentioned in might be identified with Ṭānā lake, which could suggest that the manuscript was at some point in this region.
history.provenance: The manuscript was bought by Antoine d'Abbadie sometime between 1840 and 1848.
history.acquisition: The manuscript entered the Bibliothèque nationale in 1902.

revisionDesc.change: Aligned, transcribed and corrected in Transkribus
Transformed Transkribus export to beta masaheft TEI

ልዎ፡ ይሜህር፡ በገሊላ፡ ወይሁ
ዳ፡ እንዘ፡ ይብል፡ ንጉሥ፡ አነ።
ወሀተቶ፡ ጲለጦስ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡
ወኢተሰጥዎ። ወተፈጸመ፡ ዘይ
ቤ፡ ነቢይ፡ ኢከሰተ፡ አፋሁ፡ በሕ
ማሙ፡ ሎቱ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓ
ለም፡ ገአሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን።
